\begin{abstract}
A systematic approach for the construction of a density functional for van
der Waals interactions that also accounts for saturation effects is
described, {\it i.e.} one that is applicable at short distances.  A very
efficient method to calculate the resulting expressions in the case of flat
surfaces, a method leading to an order reduction in computational
complexity, is presented.  Results for the interaction of two parallel
jellium slabs are shown to agree with those of a recent RPA calculation
(J.F. Dobson and J. Wang, Phys. Rev. Lett. {\bf 82
